posts.content:
Hi
I'm starting to plan a euro trip for my 40th next summer.
Can anyone give me some advice please?

I want to visit the Porsche, VW and Karmann museums
And take in one or two shows. I can't find the dates for hessich yet and is bad camberg usually the week before?

Cheers
Mark

Hessisch is every 4 years - the next one is in 2017.
Camberg is every 4 years as well - the next one is next year, 19/20/21 June.
A few of us lot will be heading the European Bug-In again next year in Chimay. It's the weekend after Bad Camberg so may do both shows.

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
The Empsters will be doing both shows as always

Cheers, Lee.

despite attending every one since early 90s not sure if will go to Bad Camberg next year...its not like it was...or maybe have just got jaded...bus presence is limited
but if you are into other vintage VWs then its still the event to go to....

Thanks guys that's a great help.
We are at the leave wrangling stage so far. (Trying to be ahead of the game)
We'll ask for the week before and after Bad Camberg and see what happens.
Does Bad camberg sell out?
Is there an SSVC site of choice? This is the one you camp near not at eh?
Is there a BBT cruise or is that to Hessich?
I did read the VW museum was shut one week day any ideas which one?
Same for Osnabruck and Stuttgart I wonder.

The Porsche Museum is closed on Mondays.
You know, not that i went on that day or anything...
I'll be in definitely for EBI and will have to let u know closer to the time about BC

author.location: Essex but I'm nothing like the twats on the telly.

posts.content:
The "general" site for camping us Lahn camping at Limberg. It's a lovely site in the Lahn valley on the edge of the river with a small walk into Limberg. We had a lovely week there last time as the weather was stunning and you can go canoeing on the river etc. then at the end of the week its a mellow cruise to Chimay with a relaxed mind and a sun tan.

Cheers, Lee.

To answer your question as to whether Camberg sells out, there is no admission charge/ticketing (cf. most British shows!), you just wander in. Same too for Hessisch.
So your only concern will be campsites/accommodation and logistics.
In my opinion Hessich is far superior to camberg on several levels. I'd been to camberg before but Hessich blew me away and after speaking to others I'm not alone in that opinion.

cloudinspector wrote:In my opinion Hessich is far superior to camberg on several levels. I'd been to camberg before but Hessich blew me away and after speaking to others I'm not alone in that opinion.



I totally agree I thought camberg was a poor show a line up of some average vws on what looks like an old football field. I'd opt for EBI and the bbt hospitality the night before the camberg cruise.

Buzzers

cloudinspector wrote:In my opinion Hessich is far superior to camberg on several levels. I'd been to camberg before but Hessich blew me away and after speaking to others I'm not alone in that opinion.


Yep your right Camberg was a huge let down for me it was the roadtrip that made it , if you only ever want to do one Euro show make it Hessisch unbelivable, campsite is great as well plenty of loos and showers and extremely clean cant wait for the next one but untill then its gonna be Euro Bug In

We had a lovely week there last time as the weather was stunning and you can go canoeing on the river etc. then at the end of the week its a mellow cruise to Chimay with a relaxed mind and a sun tan.

Cheers, Lee.


If you walk into town , make sure you keep an eye out for a pub selling hand kaas mit musik!! OMG!
you gotta try it just for the laugh, but only order one!

I posted a video on you tube of us lot trying it years ago, during one of the Camberg meets,(hand cheese with music)

If any of you are going to Vikky farm Id like a chat.
I'll be in a green Westy with white fuch and will have the kettle on
